N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 352.9 - Purchase of services

State Regulations

Each of the following services shall be purchased by the
social services districts for the recipient in the amount necessary, whenever
the special circumstances noted below are found to exist. The special
circumstances and the considerations entering into the agency decision to
provide such service shall be recorded. For each service purchased for which
the department has not established the fee to be paid, each social services
district shall establish the amount to be paid. For those services for which
establishment of a flat fee or a range of fees is not practicable, the amount
actually charged for such service shall be paid. Such fee schedules shall be
filed with the department in accordance with section
300.2
of this Title. Child care in
a day care center, in a family home or in-home day care shall be purchased for
eligible families except as specified in sections 352.7 and
352.19
of this Part. Payments for
child care shall be in accord with Part 416 of this Chapter. If in-home day
care is provided, provisions shall be made for workers' compensation and other
benefits as required by or pursuant to law. Notes
